aquamarine.title: Aquamarine
aquamarine.titleText: Named after seawater, aquamarine’s fresh watery hue is a cool plunge into a refreshing pool
aboutDescriptionArray: Aquamarine’s name comes from the Latin for seawater and it was said to calm waves and keep sailors safe at sea. March’s birthstone was also thought to enhance the happiness of marriages.
The best gems combine high clarity with limpid transparency and blue to slightly greenish blue hues. Like many beryls, aquamarine forms large crystals suitable for sizable fashioned gems and carvings
aquamarine.birthStoneDetails: Aquamarine is the birthstone for March and the gem of the 19th wedding anniversary.
aquamarine.treatmentsDetails: There are a number of processes used to alter the color, apparent clarity, or improve the durability of gems.
aquamarine.syntheticDetails: Some gemstones have synthetic counterparts that have essentially the same chemical, physical, and optical properties, but are grown by man in a laboratory
aquamarine.imitationsDetails: Any gem can be imitated—sometimes by manmade materials or by natural materials chosen by man to impersonate a particular gem.

moreDetails.title: 110 KILOS
moreDetails.description: The largest gem-quality aquamarine crystal mined to date is 19 inches long

moreDetails.title: BERYL
moreDetails.description: Like emerald, aquamarine is a color variety of the mineral beryl

moreDetails.title: 15,000 FEET
moreDetails.description: Aquamarine is mined at high elevations in Pakistan’s Karakoram Mountains

data.title: BEAUTIFUL CRYSTALS
data.description: quamarine grows in beautiful six-sided prismatic crystals that on rare occasions can be more than a foot long.

data.title: TRANSPARENCY
data.description: Faceted aquamarine is often exceptionally transparent with vitreous luster, so it really sparkles

data.title: DICHROIC
data.description: Using a dichroscope, you can see aquamarine is near colorless and stronger blue in different crystal directions.
